text: Although a wise man seeks no fame, a prudent leader must chase it.
Care too much about what others think of you, and you will always be their prisoner.
Opportunity opens doors, but you must be the one who walks through.
A man who displays probity is a faithful one.
Choose the virtuous path, and adhere to it.
[[b]]Rectitude[[/b]] can be increased by assignments and the resource itself
[[b]]Rectitude[[/b]] is used to purchase officers and run assignments
• Reduces desire for higher offices and salary
• Gain through passive increase and assignments
• Loss through assignments and purchasing characters

A measure of your worth as a man, and fame as a scholar. Talented bureaucrats, exiled nobles, refugee scholars and mighty warriors alike will flock to the banners of a lord they consider worthy. Prove to the realm that you are that lord.

A measure of your worth as a man, and fame as a scholar. Talented bureaucrats, exiled nobles, refugee scholars and mighty warriors alike will flock to the banners of a lord they consider worthy. Prove to the realm that you are that lord.
By giving impassioned speeches in village squares, spreading rumours and placing "gifts" in the hands of the influential, your aide can quickly spread word of your virtuous deeds.
Send your officer out to find and recruit talented and worthy men to fill the lower ranks of your offices. Reform is never cheap or easy, but can pay dividends in the long term.
